channel.title: Entrance/exit codes

item.title: Entrance/exit codes
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“u loose, post:8, topic:523147”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=641698.msg4322762#msg4322762 date=1372424715]

case 5083: case 5084: c.getPA().movePlayer(((buttonId == 5083) ? 2713 : 2744), ((buttonId == 5083) ? 9564 : 3152), 0); break;

You’ll need to change the “buttonId” to whatever the switch statement is switching on.
[/quote]

oh thankyou dude. that looks a lot cleaner![/quote]

No problem. It’s called a “ternary operator” if you wish to do further research.

Read full topic

item.title: Entrance/exit codes
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“u loose, post:10, topic:523147”][quote author=Tree link=topic=641698.msg4322821#msg4322821 date=1372429698]
I suggest that you increase what you know about Java. It’s obviously something that needs improvement. Take this as constructive criticism, not flaming.
[/quote]

i know i do. hence why i asked.[/quote]

Start on something a little more simple.
The real big index is a terrific starting point.

Read full topic

item.title: Entrance/exit codes
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

Null Amount:

I don’t understand your question. What do you mean having them “together”?

when i click brimhaven dungeon entrance it will tele me to 2713 9564 yes?
and when i leave the dungeon it will tele me to 2744 3152.

now i have 2 seperate codes for this, and im wondering to make the coding a lot cleaner is there any possible way to have them as 1 code

Read full topic

item.title: Entrance/exit codes
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

what im wondering is to make the codes more cleaner is there any way i can have the codes together instead of like this.

case 5083: c.getPA().movePlayer(2713, 9564, 0); break; case 5084: c.getPA().movePlayer(2744, 3152, 0); break;

Read full topic
